applications.description:
Job highlights
Assist in the development and design of website elements,enhancing user experience with visually appealing graphics
Job match score
Early Applicant
Keyskills
Location
Work Experience
Job description
Quick Role Summary.

As a Graphic Designer at Simublade you will be working on tools like Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) to design elements such as logos, brochures, websites, and advertisements.

We are looking for our Graphic Designer for our International office in New Delhi (Noida), India.

The role involves understanding client needs, developing concepts, and creating designs that align with brand identity and goals.

About You.

At Simublade you will be working on a variety of projects from the ground up, creating modern, accessible, and inclusive experiences for users.

You will take responsibility for the full design life cycle.

You use your intuition and insights from user research to explore and present innovative and pragmatic design solutions.

You have lots of great ideas and love iterating based on critical feedback.

In this role you will be ideating with the product team, developing original design concepts, bringing best practices to an evolving design process, and providing engineers with the resources and documentation they need to realize designs across web and native platforms, desktop, tablet, and mobile form factors.

Responsibilities.

Design and produce engaging graphics that align with our brands aesthetic and messaging for a variety of digital platforms, including our website, blog, and social media channels.

Collaborate with the marketing and content teams to create visual elements for case studies, presentations, and promotional materials.

Assist in the development and design of website elements, enhancing user experience with visually appealing graphics.

Participate in brainstorming sessions for campaign visuals and contribute innovative design ideas.

Ensure consistency in the visual branding across all digital content.

Manage and organize graphic files, including photos, logos, and art.

Qualifications.

Currently enrolled in a Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related degree program.

Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and other graphic design software.

A strong portfolio showcasing creativity, graphic design skills, and a variety of styles.

Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction.

Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.

Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Ability to meet deadlines and work on multiple projects simultaneously.

Openness to feedback and a desire to learn and improve.

Our Work.

Simublade has worked with over 100+ clients in a variety of industries such as education, healthcare, energy and more.

In addition, we are always working with exciting startups helping build their core products from the ground up.

Simublade is a multinational company that does an average of $12 million (USD) in annual revenue across its offices.

Simublade has won awards for best design and development firm multiple years in a row.

Check out some of our impactful projects at our website simublade.com.

Our Mission.

We aim to leverage the latest in technology and the ideas of invaluable thinkers to create ground-breaking solutions for every industry.

We empower the foremost drivers that pioneer the latest technological breakthroughs to propel our society toward diversity, equality and inclusion.

What Sets Us Apart.

We are a team of dreamers, explorers and creators passionate about crafting humancentered digital experiences.

Together with our clients, we aim to build products that create positive impacts around the world.

We are not just a normal software development firm.

We are a product-driven company that develops end-to-end solutions to solve problems.

At Simublade we believe in exploring the newest, cutting-edge solutions to solve real-world problems.

As a Simublade member you are not just a designer or a developer, you are dreamer and an explorer.

We dont just follow; we create the next generation of experiences for users.
